edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Game Engine, where all game logic are executed.
    Author:
    Natanael Ariawan, David Hau, Miguel Menjivar, Aidan Novobilski

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameEngine.resource
      This enumeration represents all of the possible types of extra resource objects/files used in the game

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Achievements achievements
      This field represents the set of player achievements that have been saved locally.
      static java.lang.String fileSep
      This field represents the separator character used in the OS to determine a folder or location.
      private boolean gamePlaying
      This field represents whether the game is still being played, for example whether the player has lost, won, or quit the game.
      private Highscore[] highscores
      This field represents the set of player highscores that have been saved locally.
      private Map map
      This field represents the game's Map or board, containing all Entity within the game world.
      private boolean nextLevel
      This field represents whether or not the player has decided to proceed to the next level.
      private Record records
      This field represents the set of player records that have been saved locally.
      private Shop shop
      This field represents the player's shop that has been saved locally.
      private boolean toMenu
      This field represents whether or not the player quit to the menu, or rather whether or not they manually quit the game.
      private UI ui
      This field represents the UI the player will interact with.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine(UI ui)
      This constructor method initializes the ui and map and decides whether to initialize a new local file of highscores, records, achievements, and shop or load pre-existing resource files.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHighscore()
      This method adds a newly created Highscore after the player finishes a game and the Game Over screen is printed.
      void cheat()
      This method is only invoked when the player knows the cheat code and enters it in properly when the UI.printCheat(boolean) is called.
      void gameLoop()
      This method goes through the game loop and allows the player to select options during gameplay.
      Map loadGame(java.lang.String path)
      This method will load a Map from a saved file, and returns it for the GameEngine to use.
      void loadResource(GameEngine.resource resource)
      This method loads one of the four resources that has been saved by the method, saveResource(resource), to be reused by the GameEngine.
      boolean playerMoved()
      This method moves the Player and resolves the move accordingly, the result and whether the player will move or not, is determined by this method.
      void reset()
      This method allows the player to reset the status of the game, including all of the upgrades the player has, the money they own, the highscores that have been recorded, the achievements the player has gotten, and the player records that have been recorded.
      void saveGame(java.lang.String path)
      This method will save the Map, and thus all associated objects within the game, to be reloaded and played later.
      void saveResource(GameEngine.resource resource)
      This method will save any of the four available resources as specified when the method is called to be later reloaded by the method, loadResource(resource), and reused by the GameEngine.
      void start()
      This method starts the game and creates the main loop of the entire game which encompasses the UI.mainMenu(Highscore[], boolean[], int[]), initialization of a new game, loading a saved game, or proceeding to the next level of the game.
      java.lang.String[] updateAchievements()
      This method updates the list of achievements that have been accomplished by checking through each player record after each time the player record is updated.
      void updateRecords(boolean win)
      This method updates the player records after the player finishes a game Some records, such as the number of normal levels the player has cleared, will always be updated, while others, such as the highest normal level reached in a single gameplay, will only be updated if the number of levels cleared during that gameplay is higher than the existing record.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • ui

        private UI ui
        This field represents the UI the player will interact with. This field is initialized in the constructor method, GameEngine(UI), and is called continously throughout this class.

      • map

        private Map map
        This field represents the game's Map or board, containing all Entity within the game world. A Map object can be saved from this field through the method saveGame(String) and loaded to this field through the method loadGame(String).

      • highscores

        private Highscore[] highscores
        This field represents the set of player highscores that have been saved locally. An array of Highscore objects can be saved from this field through the method saveResource(resource) and loaded to this field through the method loadResource(resource).

      • records

        private Record records
        This field represents the set of player records that have been saved locally. A Record object can be saved from this field through the method saveResource(resource) and loaded to this field through the method loadResource(resource).

      • achievements

        private Achievements achievements
        This field represents the set of player achievements that have been saved locally. An Achievements object can be saved from this field through the method saveResource(resource) and loaded to this field through the method loadResource(resource).

      • shop

        private Shop shop
        This field represents the player's shop that has been saved locally. A Shop object can be saved from this field through the method saveResource(resource) and loaded to this field through the method loadResource(resource).

      • gamePlaying

        private boolean gamePlaying
        This field represents whether the game is still being played, for example whether the player has lost, won, or quit the game.

      • toMenu

        private boolean toMenu
        This field represents whether or not the player quit to the menu, or rather whether or not they manually quit the game.

      • nextLevel

        private boolean nextLevel
        This field represents whether or not the player has decided to proceed to the next level.

      • fileSep

        public static java.lang.String fileSep
        This field represents the separator character used in the OS to determine a folder or location.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(UI ui)
        This constructor method initializes the ui and map and decides whether to initialize a new local file of highscores, records, achievements, and shop or load pre-existing resource files.
        Parameters:
        ui - the game's desired UI

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the game and creates the main loop of the entire game which encompasses the UI.mainMenu(Highscore[], boolean[], int[]), initialization of a new game, loading a saved game, or proceeding to the next level of the game. This method also prints out all of the text needed at the end of the game, including the UI.printGameOver(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, String[]) and UI.printHighscores(Highscore[]).

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        This method goes through the game loop and allows the player to select options during gameplay. The game loop can be broken through several different means. When the Enemy kills the Player enough times so that the Player runs out of lives, the Player finds the briefcase, or the player quits to the main menu, the game loop will be broken based on different criterias and the fields, toMenu, gamePlaying, and nextLevel will be set accordingly.

      • playerMoved

        public boolean playerMoved()
        This method moves the Player and resolves the move accordingly, the result and whether the player will move or not, is determined by this method.
        Returns:
        true if the player found the briefcase false otherwise

      • addHighscore

        public void addHighscore()
        This method adds a newly created Highscore after the player finishes a game and the Game Over screen is printed. This method adds the the Highscore object to the field highscores and sorts the objects using the method, Comparable.compareTo(Object), that is implemented in the Highscore class.

      • updateRecords

        public void updateRecords(boolean win)
        This method updates the player records after the player finishes a game Some records, such as the number of normal levels the player has cleared, will always be updated, while others, such as the highest normal level reached in a single gameplay, will only be updated if the number of levels cleared during that gameplay is higher than the existing record. In addition, this method will not run if the player is playing on God mode.
        Parameters:
        win - true if the records are being updated after the current level has been cleared, false otherwise

      • updateAchievements

        public java.lang.String[] updateAchievements()
        This method updates the list of achievements that have been accomplished by checking through each player record after each time the player record is updated. In addition, this method also gives the player money by adding money assigned to each achievement to the Shop object. In order to avoid giving the player achievements that have already been achieved, the first parameter checked before updating each achievement is whether or not the achievement has been achieved. Finally, this method returns an array of strings containing the names of the achievements that were achieved during the time the achievements is updated in order to be printed to the Game Over screen.
        Returns:
        an array of strings containing all of the achievements that were updated by this method

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method allows the player to reset the status of the game, including all of the upgrades the player has, the money they own, the highscores that have been recorded, the achievements the player has gotten, and the player records that have been recorded.

      • cheat

        public void cheat()
        This method is only invoked when the player knows the cheat code and enters it in properly when the UI.printCheat(boolean) is called. This method then adds a proper amount of money needed to buy every possible item in the shop.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.lang.String path)
        This method will save the Map, and thus all associated objects within the game, to be reloaded and played later.
        Parameters:
        path - the filename and location to be saved to

      • loadGame

        public Map loadGame(java.lang.String path)
        This method will load a Map from a saved file, and returns it for the GameEngine to use.
        Parameters:
        path - the filename and location to be loaded from.
        Returns:
        the loaded Map

      • saveResource

        public void saveResource(GameEngine.resource resource)
        This method will save any of the four available resources as specified when the method is called to be later reloaded by the method, loadResource(resource), and reused by the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        resource - the specified resource type to be saved

      • loadResource

        public void loadResource(GameEngine.resource resource)
        This method loads one of the four resources that has been saved by the method, saveResource(resource), to be reused by the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        resource - the specified resource type to be loaded
